results.title: Gettysburg
results.creator_credit: Ronald F Maxwell, Moctesuma Esparza, Robert Katz and Turner Pictures
results.brief_description: The American Civil War raged for nearly four years and cost over 642,000 men their lives. In a single battle, during three days of brutal combat in the town of gettysburg, nearly 50,000 soldiers were killed - more than during all the years of the Vietnam War. Though it recounts one of the bloodiest chapters in history, this film is about more than just statistics - it is the story of ordinary men caught in an extraordinary battle to fight for their beliefs and freedom. An all star cast headed by Martin Sheen, Tom Berenger, Jeff Daniels and Sam Elliot bring these remarkable characters to life in a thrilling epic that captures powerful emotions and showcases some of the most awesome action sequences ever filmed!

results.title: The Talk of the town
results.brief_description: This zany romantic comedy, nominated for six Academy Awards stars Cary Grant as Leopold Dilg, a prison escapee who hides out in the home of schoolteacher Nora, played by Jean Arthur. Leopold enlists the help of Nora to try and convince her summer tenant, Supreme Court candidate Michael Lightcap (Ronald Colman), that Dilig was falsely imprisoned on the charge of arson. As the charming and persuasive fugitive and conservative lawyer share living arrangements they also find themselves sharing a growing affection for the beautiful schoolteacher.

results.title: The Pillow book
results.creator_credit: Peter Greenaway, Kees Kasander, Studio Canal Plus, Delux Productions and Channel 4 Films
results.brief_description: An erotic fantasy that combines two limitless fascinations - flesh and literatures. Nagiko (Vivian Wu) flees an unhappy marriage in her native Japan to work as a model in Hong Kong. Nagiko holds treasured childhood memories of the annual ritual of her calligrapher father (Ken Ogata) gently painting a traditional birthday greeting on her face. In Hong Kong she takes a string of lovers, whom she values more for their calligraphy than their sexual skills, asking them to write on her body. An English lover (Ewan McGregor) suggests she starts writing herself, using her lovers as papers. However, his plan to get her writing published backfires with tragic consequences. Some sections in Japanese with English sub-titles.

results.title: Lone star
results.creator_credit: John Sayles, Maggie Renzi, R. Miller and Castle Rock Entertainment
results.brief_description: The shocking discovery of a human skull in the Texas desert starts Sheriff Sam Deeds on the trail to solve a forty-year-old mystery. Deed’s investigation implicates many in the town, both alive and dead… but most surprisingly of all, his own father, who was a legendary lawman and prominent figure in the town’s history. A typically acute, intricate and intelligent film from the most ambitious of US film directors it takes the broad canvas of a Texan border town community to explore how the past constantly impinges on the present, however much we try to fence it off.

results.title: The Last hurrah
results.brief_description: A trip to the bank to secure a loan backing a major housing project by mayor Frank Skeffington (Spencer Tracy), leads to a complicated and corrupted political campaign. The mayor is met by opposition from two of the towns key figures; Amos Force (John Carradine), publisher of the local paper, and Norman Cass Sr. (Basil Rathbone), one of the cities leading bankers. As a measure of protest they nominate the banker’s incompetent son as acting fire commissioner. In an effort to conceal his son’s ineptness the mayor is granted the loan, but in a cruel twist Norman Cass Sr. financially supports the opposition in the upcoming mayoral election and Skeffington has everything working against his re-election. Also starring Jeffrey Hunter, Diane Foster, Pat O’Brien and James Gleason and based on the novel by Edwin O’Connor.

results.title: Cat Ballou
results.creator_credit: Elliot Silverstein, Harold Hecht and Harold Hecht Corporation
results.brief_description: Lee Marvin stars as both Tim Strawn (a noseless gunslinger) and Kid Shelleen, the woozy, boozy has-been who goes up against Strawn at high noon. Jane Fonda, at the height of her sex-kitten period, stars as Cat Ballou, the schoolmarm-turned outlaw who teams with Kid to protect her father’s ranch from a greedy railroad tycoon. One of the biggest box office hits of 1965, “Cat Ballou” was declared an instant classic with its sly blend of Western parody and rapid-fire action. Directed by Elliot Silverstein.

results.title: Jubal
results.creator_credit: Delmer Daves, William Fadiman and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Paul Wellman, this is a loose reworking of Shakepeare’s Othello into a western setting. Jubal Troop (Glenn Ford), a drifter given a job by his friend, a rancher Shep Horgan (Borgnine), makes an enemy of the range rider (Steiger) when Shep’s restless wife, Mae, is attracted to the newcomer. Driven by jealousy, Pinky sets out to frame Jubal and plants in Shep’s mind the suspicion that Jubal is carrying on with Mae. Wanting to hurt both Shep who she doesn’t love, and Jubal who has spurned her, Mae untruthfully confirms Pinky’s story. Shep goes gunning for Jubalm and the heat of the Wild West is matched by the passions at Horgan’s ranch, as anger turns to treachery…and murder.

results.title: In the line of fire
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Petersen, Jeff Apple and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Secret Service Agent, Frank Horrigan (Clint Eastwood) is forced into a test of wills by master assassin (John Malkovich) in a fight to save the president. It is an all too familiar situation for Horrigan who was present when Kennedy was shot and is haunted by the possibility that he could have saved his life. Assigned to protect the current president, the assassin tests Horrigan to see whether given the second chance he will risk his life to save the president. Also starring Rene Russo, Dylan McDermott, Fred Dalton Thompson and John Mahoney.

results.title: Funny girl
results.creator_credit: William Wyler, Ray Stark and Rastar Productions
results.brief_description: Barbara Streisand stars as Fanny Brice in the role which earned her the 1968 Oscar for Best Actress. From humble beginnings and her mother as the sole supporter, Fanny joins the famous Ziegfeld follies. Conscious of her looks and apprehesive about singing about her beauty, Fanny subverts the Ziegfeld model and plays it as a comic role. Her career is successful, but her private life is plagued by the misfortunes of her gambling hudsband, Nick Arnstein (Omar Sharif), jealous of his wife’s success. Includes memorable hits such as “Don’t rain on my parade” and “People”.

results.title: Holiday
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Everett Riskin and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Adapted from Philip Barry’s play and a remake of a film made in 1930, George Cukor’s “Holiday” is a wonderful comedy which subtly examines the lives of an unhappy wealth family and a carefree young man who enters their plush world. When Johnny Case (Cary Grant) returns from a skiing holiday to visit his fiance Julie Seton (Doris Nolan) he is shocked to discover she is very very rich. Soon Julie’s father is mapping out their lives, but Julie’s non-conformist sister Linda (Katherine Hepburn) and alcholic brother Ned (Lew Ayres) think that Johnny’s fresh enthusiasm for life could be the antidote for their father’s tiranic rule. Hepburn and Grant give fantastic performances and Cukor’s direction ensures that this is a sparkling romantic comedy.
